dev.jeka.core.api.java.project

Class JkJavaProjectPublication

  • java.lang.Object
    • dev.jeka.core.api.java.project.JkJavaProjectPublication

  • public class JkJavaProjectPublication
extends java.lang.Object
    Responsible to publish artifacts on the repository. If the project does not publish anything, this part can be ignored. Jeka can publish on Maven and Ivy repositories.

    From here, you can control what to publish and the transitive dependencies, depending on the repo system the project is published. Note that a project can be be published on many repositories of different systems.

      • apply

        public JkJavaProjectPublication apply(java.util.function.Consumer<JkJavaProjectPublication> consumer)

      • getModuleId

        public JkModuleId getModuleId()
        Returns the module id (group and name) for this project. This information is used for naming produced artifact files, publishing. It is also consumed by tools as SonarQube. If no moduleId has been explicitly set, this methods a module id inferred from the project base directory name.

      • setModuleId

      • setVersionSupplier

        public JkJavaProjectPublication setVersionSupplier(java.util.function.Supplier<JkVersion> versionSupplier)
        Set the version supplier used to compute this project version. For example, it can be :
        • A hardcoded supplier as : () -> 1.0.0<
        • A dynamic supplier based on VCS versioning as : () -> JkGitWrapper.of(baseDir).getVersionFromTags
        • Any code retrieving version from env var, property files, ....
        This version information is used for publishing project artifacts on binary repository, but also may be used by tools as Sonarqube to identify projects.

        The default value is JkVersion.UNSPECIFIED
